basic_info.description: Hello! I'm a software engineer based in Dallas-Fort Worth who is captivated by the dynamic world of technology and innovation. After graduating from the University of Texas at Arlington, I leaped from finance to start my tech journey in mid-2022. Now, in winter 2023, I've honed my skills through a 5-month advanced software engineering immersive and a 12-week program as a Junior Java Developer Trainee with FDM. Detail-oriented and committed to clean coding, I specialize in developing user-friendly websites and applications. Beyond coding, I enjoy reading, painting, cooking, and exploring new places with friends and family. I usually have a coding companion, Luna, my 5-year-old cat who doubles as my programmer's rubber duck. Now, let's bring innovative ideas to life together! I'd love for you to check out my resume and send me an email.

projects.title: Tripper
projects.description: Tripper is a travel journal designed for the new age nomad. Our team of creators has made a beautiful and intuitive application that allows users to create a history of all their amazing travels including each stop made along the way. Tripper travelers can include their favorite photo as the main display of the trip and let the smart app provide a professional picture for each related stop. All the fun had along the way can be documented in each stop, and an overview of the entire trip will remind our users what they did every time they go to the home page.

projects.title: AutoScape
projects.description: AutoScape was developed to manage various aspects of an automobile dealership including inventory, service center, and sales. Polling was leveraged to ensure data integrity and syncing between three databases linked to four microservices. I implemented form submission for client-side appointment scheduling and search/filter components to enhance user experience and increase website traffic. The sales management module is a user-friendly interface built using React, allowing dealerships to easily add and delete vehicle sales from the system, as well as keep track of all salesperson records.  Additionally, the application has a feature of VIP status, which is implemented for automobiles that have been serviced more than once.

projects.title: Task Manager
projects.description: Designed to help users manage their tasks efficiently for individual and/or group projects. It has user-focused features such as login, logout, and signup that make it easy for users to access and utilize the app. With this app, users can add multiple separate projects where they can edit, create, and delete certain tasks. Additionally, a user can assign tasks to specific team members, increasing team efficiency and decreasing project completion time/conflicts!

projects.title: Door Hopper
projects.description: Designed specifically for a door to door solar panel sales company, Door Hopper uses the Google API to keep track of all addresses/locations of the company's potential customers. It features a client-side form where customers can leave their information and schedule an appointment for a consult with a sales professional or for solar panel installation with a technician. It has a secure database of all customers and their information which only certain company members can access.

projects.title: A Dusty Portfolio
projects.description: This was the first portfolio I ever developed for myself, it is an older model that I like to look back on and see how far I've come. I wanted to include it because it was built from the ground up utilizing NextJS for the backend and React for the frontend. I also implemented Incremental Static Regeneration with Sanity.io which allowed me to easily update contents without needing to redeploy with each update. The UI design was thanks to my skills with Tailwind CSS and the animations were made with Framer Motion.
